name: la
content:
la

noun
 
/lɑː/
 
/lɑː/
(also lah)
(music)
jump to other results
  1. the 6th note of a major scale see also à la
See la in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: la

name: LA
content:
LA

abbreviation
 
/ˌel ˈeɪ/
 
/ˌel ˈeɪ/
(also L.A.)
jump to other results
  1. the city of Los Angeles
    CultureLos Angeles is the second largest city in the US and the largest in California. It covers a very large area in the southern part of the state on the Pacific coast, and is connected by the world's largest road system. The city is famous for Hollywood and Beverly Hills and its tourist attractions include Sunset Boulevard, the Hollywood Bowl, Universal Pictures and Rodeo Drive. Los Angeles is one of the busiest US ports and is an important industrial centre. The US captured the town from the Mexicans in 1846, and oil was discovered there at the end of the 19th century.Los Angeles
See LA in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: LA

name: lah
content:
lah

noun
 
/lɑː/
 
/lɑː/
(also la)
(music)
jump to other results
  1. the 6th note of a major scale
    Word OriginMiddle English: representing (as an arbitrary name for the note) the first syllable of Latin labii, taken from a Latin hymn.
Check pronunciation: lah

name: lanthanum
content:
lanthanum

noun
 
/ˈlænθənəm/
 
/ˈlænθənəm/
[uncountable]
(symbol La)
jump to other results
  1. a chemical element. Lanthanum is a silver-white metal.
    Word Originmid 19th cent.: from Greek lanthanein ‘escape notice’ (because for a long time it was undetected in cerium oxide) + -um.
See lanthanum in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: lanthanum

name: Los Angeles
content:
Los Angeles

 
/ˌlɒs ˈændʒəliːz/
 
/ˌlɔːs ˈændʒələs/
(also also informal LA
 
/ˌel ˈeɪ/
 
/ˌel ˈeɪ/
)
jump to other results
  1. the second largest city in the US and the largest in California. It covers a very large area in the southern part of the state on the Pacific coast, and is connected by the world's largest road system. The city is famous for Hollywood and Beverly Hills and its tourist attractions include Sunset Boulevard, the Hollywood Bowl, Universal Pictures and Rodeo Drive. Los Angeles is one of the busiest US ports and is an important industrial centre. The US captured the town from the Mexicans in 1846, and oil was discovered there at the end of the 19th century. see also UCLA
See Los Angeles in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: Los Angeles
matches: the University of California, Los Angeles
relatives: the University of California, Los Angeles

name: à la
content:
à la

preposition
 
/ˈɑː lɑː/
 
/ˈɑː lɑː/
(from French)
jump to other results
  1. in the same style as somebody/something else
    • a new band that sings à la Beatles
See à la in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: à la

name: La Niña
content:
La Niña

noun
 
/lɑː ˈniːnjə/
 
/lɑː ˈniːnjə/
[uncountable]
jump to other results
  1. the cooling of the water in the central and eastern Pacific Ocean that happens every few years and that affects the weather in many parts of the world compare El Niño (1)
See La Niña in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: La Niña

name: la-la land
content:
la-la land

noun
 
/ˈlɑː lɑː lænd/
 
/ˈlɑː lɑː lænd/
[uncountable] (North American English, informal)
jump to other results
  1. (British English cloud cuckoo land)
     (disapproving) if you say that somebody is living in la-la land, you mean that they do not understand what a situation is really like, but think it is much better than it is
  2. Los Angeles or Hollywood, especially with regard to the film and television industry
    3. Word Originla-la, reduplication of LA (i.e. Los Angeles).
See la-la land in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: la-la land

name: la-di-da
content:
la-di-da

exclamation
 
/ˌlɑː di ˈdɑː/
 
/ˌlɑː di ˈdɑː/
(also lah-di-dah)
jump to other results
  1. used when somebody is annoying you, because they seem to think they are more important than they really are
    • ‘We stayed at the Grand Hotel Imperial.’ ‘Well, la-di-da!’
    Word Originlate 19th cent.: imitative of an affected manner of speech.
See la-di-da in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: la-di-da

name: la-di-da
content:
la-di-da

adjective
 
/ˌlɑː di ˈdɑː/
 
/ˌlɑː di ˈdɑː/
(also lah-di-dah)
(especially British English, informal)
jump to other results
  1. used to describe a way of speaking or behaving that is typical of upper-class people but that is not natural or sincere synonym affected
    • I can’t stand Jane or her la-di-da friends.
    Word Originlate 19th cent.: imitative of an affected manner of speech.
See la-di-da in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: la-di-da

name: à la mode
content:
à la mode

adjective, adverb
 
/ˌɑː lɑː ˈməʊd/
 
/ˌɑː lɑː ˈməʊd/
(from French)
jump to other results
  1. [not before noun] (old-fashioned) fashionable; in the latest fashion
    • We’ll get Papa to buy you something a little more à la mode.
  2. [after noun] (North American English) served with ice cream
    • apple pie à la mode
See à la mode in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: à la mode

name: Shangri-La
content:
Shangri-La

noun
 
/ˌʃæŋɡri ˈlɑː/
 
/ˌʃæŋɡri ˈlɑː/
[singular]
jump to other results
  1. a place that is extremely beautiful and where everything seems perfect, especially a place far away from modern life
    More Like This Expressions from literary sourcesExpressions from literary sources
    • Alice in Wonderland
    • Casanova
    • Cassandra
    • Don Juan
    • Dorian Gray
    • Falstaffian
    • Frankenstein
    • Jekyll and Hyde
    • Lilliputian
    • Lothario
    • Orwellian
    • Pandora’s box
    • Peter Pan
    • Pied Piper
    • Pollyanna
    • Rip Van Winkle
    • Ruritanian
    • Scrooge
    • Shangri-La
    • Sherlock
    • Stepford Wife
    • Svengali
    • Tweedledum and Tweedledee
    • Utopia
    • Walter Mitty
    Word OriginFrom the name of an imaginary valley in Tibet in James Hilton’s novel Lost Horizon, where people do not grow old.
    Word Originfrom Shangri (an invented name) + la Tibetan ‘mountain pass’.
See Shangri-La in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: Shangri-La

name: à la carte
content:
à la carte

adjective, adverb
 
/ˌɑː lɑː ˈkɑːt/
 
/ˌɑː lɑː ˈkɑːrt/
 (from French)
jump to other results
  1. if food in a restaurant is à la carte, or if you eat à la carte, you choose from a list of dishes that have separate prices, rather than having a complete meal at a fixed price
    • There is an excellent à la carte restaurant for hotel residents.
    • It was more expensive to eat à la carte.
    Wordfinder
    • à la carte
    • course
    • cuisine
    • menu
    • order
    • reservation
    • restaurant
    • service charge
    • speciality
    • waiter
    Topics Cooking and eatingc2
    Oxford Collocations Dictionaryà la carte is used with these nouns:
    • menu
    • restaurant
    See full entry
See à la carte in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: à la carte

name: la dolce vita
content:
la dolce vita

noun
 
/lɑː ˌdɒltʃeɪ ˈviːtə/
 
/lɑː ˌdəʊltʃeɪ ˈviːtə/
[singular] (from Italian)
jump to other results
  1. a life of pleasure and expensive things, without any worries
See la dolce vita in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: la dolce vita

name: La Guardia Airport
content:
La Guardia Airport

 
/lə ˌɡwɑːdiə ˈeəpɔːt/
 
/lə ˌɡwɑːrdiə ˈerpɔːrt/
jump to other results
  1. an airport in New York City used mostly for flights within the country. It is in north Queens and is the closest to Manhattan of New York's three airports.
Check pronunciation: La Guardia Airport

name: vive la difference
content:
vive la difference

exclamation
 
/ˌviːv lɑː ˌdɪfəˈrɒns/
 
/ˌviːv lɑː ˌdɪfəˈrɑːns/
(from French, humorous)
jump to other results
  1. used to show that you think it is good that there is a difference between two people or things, especially a difference between men and women
    Word Originfrom French vive la différence, literally ‘long live the difference’.
See vive la difference in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: vive la difference

name: crème de la crème
content:
crème de la crème

noun
 
/ˌkrem də lɑː ˈkrem/
 
/ˌkrem də lɑː ˈkrem/
[singular] (from French, formal or humorous)
jump to other results
  1. the best people or things of their kind
    • This school takes only the crème de la crème.
See crème de la crème in the Oxford Advanced American Dictionary
Check pronunciation: crème de la crème

name: Walter de la Mare
content:
Walter de la Mare

 
/ˌwɔːltə də lə ˈmeə(r)/
 
/ˌwɔːltər də lə ˈmer/
jump to other results
  1. (1873-1956) an English writer of poems, novels and short stories for adults and children. His best-known works are the poems Songs of Childhood (1902), The Listeners (1912), Peacock Pie (1913) and the novel Memoirs of a Midget (1921).
Check pronunciation: Walter de la Mare

name: Fiorello La Guardia
content:
Fiorello La Guardia

 
/fiːəˌreləʊ lə ˈɡwɑːdiə/
 
/fiːəˌreləʊ lə ˈɡwɑːrdiə/
jump to other results
  1. (1882-1947) a popular mayor of New York (1933-45). He was known as the 'Little Flower', which is what Fiorello means in Italian. He began his career as a Republican politician and was elected to the US Congress (1917-19 and 1923-33). As mayor, he introduced measures to deal with problems of health, housing, transport and crime. During a newspaper strike in 1937 he pleased children by reading comic strips on the radio. La Guardia Airport is named after him.
Check pronunciation: Fiorello La Guardia

name: La Belle Dame Sans Merci
content:
La Belle Dame Sans Merci

 
/lə ˌbel dɒm ˌsɒ̃ mɜːˈsiː/
 
/lə ˌbel dɑːm ˌsɑ̃ː mɜːrˈsiː/
jump to other results
  1. one of the best-known poems by John Keats about a knight who falls in love with a beautiful woman with magic powers. He dreams that he is with her in the countryside, but wakes up alone and sad.
Check pronunciation: La Belle Dame Sans Merci
